channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Carries Out Strikes on Houthis in Yemen
item.description: The Houthis, who are backed by Iran, have targeted commercial ships in the Red Sea in solidarity with Hamas in Gaza. They launched a missile at Israel...

item.title: Victim of Coney Island Subway Immolation Is Identified by the Police
item.description: Debrina Kawam of Toms River, N.J., was burned alive on Dec. 22 in a videotaped killing that shocked New York.

item.title: Putin Declares ‘Everything Will Be Fine’ Despite Russia’s Growing Challenges

item.title: Germany’s Chancellor Scholz Takes a Jab at Musk in New Year’s Eve Address
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz said Germany’s election would “not be decided by the owners of social media channels” in his annual New Year’s Eve address.

item.title: Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt Settle Divorce After Eight Years
item.description: The settlement resolves a key part of the protracted end of their very public Hollywood romance.

item.title: Here’s what experts predict for 2025 across women’s sports, women’s health, and the C-suite
item.description: Experts see opportunity and challenges ahead.

item.title: How to watch the Times Square ball drop on New Year’s Eve 2024 for free—and without cable
item.description: Here’s how to join the party in Times Square, without the crowds or odors.

item.title: Americans Are Actually More United Than You Might Think
item.description: Americans think of our society as so divided. Might there be some upside to starting the new year knowing we aren’t as polarized as we thought?

item.title: Walmart is selling a $78 dupe of the Hermès Birkin bag that fans say is so realistic it makes the expensive one obsolete
item.description: The Kamugo leather handbag is just 1% of the price of the Birkin.
